author: wsjcom
title: Immigrants Vital to Avoid Demographic Void
text:
How ironic that “Immigrant Bills Split House GOP” and “Births Hit Lowest Number Since 1987” ran opposite each other (U.S. News, May 17). What a perfect opportunity to point out the economic implications of limiting immigration when the U.S. birth rate is at an all-time low.
Setting aside one’s views on the politics or morality of U.S. immigration practices, it is important to recognize the economic impact of restricting immigration, both on GDP growth and on Social Security’s ability to fund its future obligations. Given the...
